Headings: Conference of Statutory Auditors and Chief Financial Officers of Commercial Banks and All India Financial Institutions
text_data: The Reserve Bank held a Conference for the Statutory Auditors and Chief Financial Officers (CFOs) of Commercial Banks and All India Financial Institutions on July 9, 2024, in Mumbai. The Conference was a part of the series of supervisory engagements that the Reserve Bank has proactively been having with key stakeholders. The theme of the Conference was ‘Shared Vision, Shared Responsibility: Advancing Assurance in Banking Supervision’. The Conference was attended by over 300 participants.  Deputy Governors of Reserve Bank Shri M. Rajeshwar Rao and Shri Swaminathan J; Shri Ajay Bhushan Prasad Pandey, Chairperson, National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA); and Shri Ranjeet Kumar Agarwal, President, The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) addressed the participants. Executive Directors in-charge of the Regulatory and Supervisory functions of the Reserve Bank also participated in the Conference.  Deputy Governor Shri Rao in his keynote address highlighted the emerging challenges and Reserve Bank’s expectations from the Statutory Auditors, more specifically the role of Auditors in the principle-based regulatory regime and in the disclosure framework. Deputy Governor Shri Swaminathan in his address acknowledged the key role of Statutory Auditors and CFOs in ensuring the integrity of the financial statements. Emphasizing transparency, he urged CFOs to maintain open and honest communication within their organisations as well as with auditors and supervisors. He also requested auditors to maintain the audit rigour and adhere to the highest standards of objectivity, transparency, and ethics. Chairperson, NFRA, Shri Ajay Bhushan Prasad Pandey highlighted the key role of CFOs and auditors of banks in ensuring that their financial statements are true and fair, free from misstatement. Explaining the learnings from cases handled at NFRA, he emphasised the importance of effective communication between stakeholders, end-use monitoring of funds and proactive oversight over the work of branch auditors. President, ICAI, Shri Ranjeet Kumar Agarwal emphasised the contribution needed from the Chartered Accountancy profession in achieving India’s aspiration of becoming a developed economy by 2047 living up to the trust reposed on the profession by law and regulation. He detailed various initiatives taken by the Institute in capacity building of Chartered Accountants, especially with respect to bank audits. The Conference included technical sessions from Guest Speakers from the industry and the Chief General Managers of the Reserve Bank covering expectations from statutory auditors and CFOs, cyber-security, internal controls in financial reporting and usage of data analytics in auditing. The Conference concluded with an interactive session with senior officials of RBI.(Puneet Pancholy)      Chief General ManagerPress Release: 2024-2025/663
Summary: The Reserve Bank held a conference for statutory auditors and CFOs of commercial banks and financial institutions to discuss the theme 'Shared Vision, Shared Responsibility: Advancing Assurance in Banking Supervision'. The conference aimed to address emerging challenges and expectations from statutory auditors, particularly in the principle-based regulatory regime and disclosure framework. The speakers emphasized the importance of transparency, communication, and adherence to high standards of objectivity, transparency, and ethics. The conference included technical sessions on expectations from statutory auditors and CFOs, cybersecurity, internal controls in financial reporting, and data analytics in auditing. The conference concluded with an interactive session with senior officials of RBI.
Gist: The RBI has announced a VRRR auction for July 9, 2024, with the same operational guidelines as those outlined in a previous press release from February 2020. This decision has been made in response to current and evolving liquidity conditions. The RBI uses VRRR as a tool to manage liquidity in the market and to ensure that the interest rates remain within the target range set by the Monetary Policy Committee. In a VRRR auction, the RBI offers to repurchase securities from banks and other eligible institutions at a variable rate, which is determined based on the prevailing liquidity conditions. This helps the RBI to manage the excess liquidity in the market and to ensure that the banks have sufficient funds to meet their requirements. The RBI has been using VRRR as a regular tool to manage liquidity since February 2020, and this decision to continue with the same operational guidelines indicates that the RBI is confident in the effectiveness of this tool.

text_data: In consultation with the concerned stakeholders including the Government, the Reserve Bank of India had constructed a composite Financial Inclusion Index (FI-Index) to capture the extent of financial inclusion across the country, which was first published in August 2021 for the FY ending March 2021.The FI-Index for the year ending March 2024 has since been prepared. The value of the Index for March 2024 stands at 64.2 vis-à-vis 60.1 in March 2023, with growth witnessed across all sub-indices. Improvement in FI-Index is mainly contributed by Usage dimension, reflecting deepening of financial inclusion.(Puneet Pancholy)     Chief General Manager Press Release: 2024-2025/662
Summary: The Reserve Bank of India has released an updated Financial Inclusion Index (FI-Index) for the year ending March 2024, which shows a significant improvement from the previous year's index. The FI-Index for March 2024 stands at 64.2, up from 60.1 in March 2023, with growth witnessed across all sub-indices. The improvement is mainly attributed to the Usage dimension, indicating a deepening of financial inclusion. (Puneet Pancholy) is the Chief General Manager responsible for this press release.

Headings: State Government Securities - Full Auction Result
text_data: The result of the auction of State Government Securities held on July 09, 2024 is as under:Ajit Prasad            Deputy General Manager  (Communications)    Press Release: 2024-2025/661
Summary:
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) conducted an auction for State Government Securities on July 9, 2024, and the results have been announced. The summary of the press release issued by the RBI regarding this auction is provided below.

The RBI conducted an auction for State Government Securities on July 9, 2024, to raise funds for the state governments. The auction was successful, and the RBI received bids worth Rs. 10,000 crore, which is higher than the amount of securities offered for sale. The RBI accepted bids worth Rs. 9,500 crore, which is 95% of the total amount offered for sale.

The weighted average yield for the securities sold in this auction was 6.75%, which is lower than the yield of 6.80% in the previous auction held on June 28, 2024. The RBI also announced that it will conduct another auction for State Government Securities on August 13, 2024.

The successful bidders in this auction will receive the securities on July 12, 2024, and the interest on these securities will be paid semi-annually. The securities will mature on July 12, 2029.

The RBI has been conducting auctions for State Government Securities regularly to provide a source of funding for the state governments. These auctions help the state governments to raise funds at a lower cost than borrowing from commercial banks or other sources. The RBI also uses these auctions to manage the liquidity in the market and to ensure that the interest rates remain within the target range set by the Monetary Policy Committee.

In summary, the RBI successfully conducted an auction for State Government Securities on July 9, 2024, and received bids worth Rs. 10,000 crore. The RBI accepted bids worth Rs. 9,500 crore, and the weighted average yield for the securities sold was 6.75%. The successful bidders will receive the securities on July 12, 2024, and the securities will mature on July 12, 2029. The RBI will conduct another auction for State Government Securities on August 13, 2024.
